solution_line_template: They started with {initial_passengers} passengers. {got_off_texas} got off and {got_on_texas} got on so {initial_passengers}-{got_off_texas}+{got_on_texas} = <<{initial_passengers}-{got_off_texas}+{got_on_texas}={passengers_after_texas}>>{passengers_after_texas}

{passengers_after_texas} people flew to NC where {got_off_nc} passengers got off and {got_on_nc} got on. This flight now had {passengers_after_texas}-{got_off_nc}+{got_on_nc} = <<{passengers_after_texas}-{got_off_nc}+{got_on_nc}={passengers_after_nc}>>{passengers_after_nc}
There were also {crew_members} crew members so {passengers_after_nc}+{crew_members} = {total_people_landed} passengers landed in Virginia
